title: Design a Preclinical Animal Study
description: A research scientist needs to design a protocol for a new preclinical toxicology study in rats.

tasks.description: Define the study objectives, such as determining the maximum tolerated dose (MTD).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent clearly states the primary objective of the study.

tasks.description: Select the animal model, dose levels, and duration of the study.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent designs a study with 4 dose groups (including control) to be run for 28 days.

tasks.description: Define the study endpoints, including clinical observations, body weights, and terminal histopathology.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent creates a comprehensive list of all data points to be collected.

tasks.description: Draft the study protocol document and submit it for review by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent writes the full protocol and submits it for ethical review.
